H0.text: The plants make the pond look beautiful by helping counteract the algae overgrowth that resulted from Joann repeatedly overfeeding fish, which produced excess nitrates in the pond.

H1.text: The plants will camouflage the green algae that overgrew the pond behind Joann’s house after she repeatedly overfed the fish, which increased nitrates.

H2.text: The plants added by Joann will compete with algae for nutrients in the pond behind her house, helping correct the algae overgrowth caused by excess nitrates from overfeeding the fish.

H3.text: The plants will provide all the food for the fish, thereby helping to reduce the excess nitrates that caused algae overgrowth in the pond behind Joann’s house.

A4.text: Aquatic plants are important primary producers and are the basis of food web for many aquatic fauna, especially wetland species. They compete with phytoplanktons for excess nutrients such as nitrogen and phosphorus, thus reducing the prevalence of eutrophication and harmful algal blooms
